intro: Porana gagnepainiana, commonly known as the Gagnepain's porana, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
